ISSUE.TITLE: Modeler: Start event registry event loses value of interrupting flag when model is exported to BPMN 2.0
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Describe the bug** Create an event sub process in the modeler containing a start event registry event with the interrupting flag set to false. When the model is exported to a BPMN 2.0 xml file the start event registry event does not contain the isInterrupting attribute. The default value for this attribute is true, so the value specified in the modeler is changed from false to true during the export. When the model is imported from the previously exported xml file the interrupting flag in the modeler is now true in stead of false. **Expected behavior** The interrupting flag of a start event registry event is exported to the BPMN 2.0 xml file. **Code** ![start-event-registry-event](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35045227/193409196-22560fae-a5ad-4a1a-b2ef-b562d517df52.png) ``` <process id="test" name="test" isExecutable="true"> <subProcess id="sid-E43E2F3A-4566-4AAD-A270-EDDA183CBA6A" name="subProcess" triggeredByEvent="true"> <startEvent id="sid-74E5B160-CC32-452B-B8A5-0179F927D2BD"> <extensionElements> <flowable:eventType xmlns:flowable="http://flowable.org/bpmn"><![CDATA[eventKey]]></flowable:eventType> </extensionElements> </startEvent> <endEvent id="sid-C56E1AFB-73ED-4C4A-B9A5-2E1CBEA9DE38"></endEvent> <sequenceFlow id="sid-FB9F50C5-B7F6-4E3D-97BA-9C8EE12450FD" sourceRef="sid-74E5B160-CC32-452B-B8A5-0179F927D2BD" targetRef="sid-C56E1AFB-73ED-4C4A-B9A5-2E1CBEA9DE38"></sequenceFlow> </subProcess> <startEvent id="sid-F82FC7D5-87C9-4149-AD6A-1F96B44D7F0C" flowable:formFieldValidation="true"></startEvent> <endEvent id="sid-1025DEF5-F71B-420F-B45D-4DDEA9E7D116"></endEvent> <sequenceFlow id="sid-5FDA8999-573D-4C7E-8502-6CA1EB53F0A9" sourceRef="sid-F82FC7D5-87C9-4149-AD6A-1F96B44D7F0C" targetRef="sid-1025DEF5-F71B-420F-B45D-4DDEA9E7D116"></sequenceFlow> </process> ``` **Additional context** Flowable 6.7.3-SNAPSHOT

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixed export of start event registry event isInterrupting flag (#3476)
Fixed export of start event registry event isInterrupting flag (#3476) (#3477)
